switch to not indexing samples like a data frame

Merge pull request #40 from dchudz/patch-1

replace rep with repeat
replace semicolin with comma

switch to not indexing samples like a data frame

It looks like the switch away from using data frames broke this example. I think this works as intended now.

replace rep with repeat

I guess ```rep``` must have previously existed and no longer does? Or there's an unstated dependency? Anyway, I believe my change has the intended behavior.

I ran into this running Example 2 from the README, and until this change I got this error:

ERROR: rep not defined
 in run_seqmc at /Users/david/.julia/MCMC/src/runners/SeqMC.jl:104
 in run at /Users/david/.julia/MCMC/src/runners/runners.jl:28

Completed integration of slice sampler with MCMC package (test is now successful)

Started integrating slice sampler into MCMC
Setting up test suite: added tuners' testing

Completed interface between MCMC and Distributions for multivariate and univariate distribtions (works in general any sampler). Added examples in the examples folder.
Made model work with univariate distributions and any sampler
Created main interface between MCMC and Distributions (experimental, working with Random Walk Metropolis, there is a small bug to sort before it works with Hamiltonian Monte Carlo)
Removed Rao-Blackwellised version of HMC (yet another research idea that failed by inflating the variance)
